message: in some forums this is alleviated by a non-linear list of replies. i just don't see how this could work here... google wave provided something like this (replying to an earlier post showed your reply indented below the original post), but i don't think that this works well in a more chat-like system as this

here's something i was pondering a while about: sometimes the discussion in a given topic starts to diverge, e.g. there is actually a new topic being brought up and both unrelated topics are being discussed along each other. in such cases it is sometimes desirable to be able to split those topics (e.g. in order to be able to follow the discussion more easily)

so i don't have a really good solution (how should split a topic actually work?) but the problem is there: sometimes it would be nice if one could move or copy existing posts/replies to another topic.
